===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=き}} {{m|zh|貴|tr=kjwɨj<sup>H</sup>|lit=precious, noble, superior}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|き}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|き}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=き|archaic}} added to nouns related to people to indicate [[superiority]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''貴'''公子、'''貴'''婦人、'''貴'''賓|'''き'''こうし、 '''き'''ふじん、'''き'''ひん|[young] '''noble'''man, '''noble'''woman, '''superior''' guest}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=き|archaic}} added to nouns to indicate [[respect]] and possession: [[your]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''貴'''店|'''き'''てん|'''your [honorable]''' store}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|貴様|きさま}}: [[you]] {{qualifier|[[derogatory]]: the original “superior” meaning degraded over time, becoming [[ironic]], and then [[insulting]]}}
{{der-bottom}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|き}}

# added after nouns related to people to express love and respect

=====Usage notes=====
This suffix meaning appears from roughly the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]].

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|兄貴|あにき}}: my [beloved] [[elder]] [[brother]]
* {{ja-r|姉貴|あねき}}: my [beloved] elder [[sister]]
* {{ja-r|伯父貴|おじき}}: my [beloved] [[uncle]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
Unknown. Possibly cognate with {{m|ja|当て|tr=ate||aim; expectation, hope}}, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|当てる|tr=ateru||to face one thing towards another; to make something hit a target}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あて}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=naru|あて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あて|archaic}} [[noble]], [[aristocratic]], [[high-born]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=あて|archaic}} [[refined]], [[elegant]]

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あて|archaic}} one's own [[father]] {{qualifier|by extension of the “noble” meaning}}
#* '''1028-1107''': [[:ja:w:栄花物語|{{lang|ja|栄花物語}}]] (''[[w:Eiga Monogatari|Eiga Monogatari]]'', “Tale of Splendor”)
#*: {{ja-usex|'''貴'''は麿をば恋しとは思ひ給はぬか|^'''あて''' は まろ をば こいし と は おもひたまはぬ か|Doesn't '''father''' think I'm his darling?}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|貴人|あてびと}}: an [[aristocrat]]; a [[nobleman]]; a person with a [[noble]] and [[refined]] [[bearing]]
* {{ja-r|貴ぶ|あてぶ}}: to be [[refined]] and [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴ばむ|あてばむ}}: to appear [[refined]] and [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴はか|あてはか}}: [[refined]], [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴やか|あてやか}}: [[refined]], [[elegant]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
Possibly a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=むち|身|tr1=mu|t1=body|霊|tr2=chi|t2=spirit, essence, soul}}. Alternatively, may be an alteration of {{m|ja|睦|tr=mutsu||friendly, harmonious|pos=affix not used in isolation}}, probably caused by fusion with the {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むち}} emphatic nominal particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}} in a manner similar to the alteration between ''kamu'' (combining form) and ''kami'' (standalone form) for {{m|ja|神||god, spirit}}, or ''kutsu'' (combining form) and ''kuchi'' (standalone form) for {{m|ja|口||mouth}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=むち|archaic}} an [[honorific]] term for a [[deity]] or [[person]]
#: {{ja-usex|大日孁の'''貴'''|おおひるめ の '''むち'''|literally “'''honorable''' woman of the great sun”, an [[epithet]] for the sun goddess [[Amaterasu]]}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|汝|なむち}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
Used as [[ateji]] in various names.
